name: Barranco Oscuro, pioneers' reds.
description: Barranco Oscuro Discover the wines of Barranco Oscuro, the natural wine pioneer from the mountains of southern Spain. All the wines coming from the domains' organically grown vineyards, produced without any additives. High altitude vineyards ensures a nice acidity in all of their wines. 1 x BO2 2011, 100% Tempranillo for your thirst. 1 x El Pino Rojo 2010, 100% Pinot Noir, elegant and smooth. 1 x Rubaiyat 2009, 100% powerful Syrah with rippen tanins. 1 x Garnata 2009, 100% tasty Garnacha. 1 x 1368 Pago Cerro Las Monjas 2004, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Garnacha, Merlot, Syrah. Minerality, complexity. 1 x 1368 Pago Cerro Las Monjas 2005, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Garnacha, Merlot. The juice of schists.

name: Barranco Oscuro Brut Natural Millesime 2006
description: Barranco Oscuro VSPA PVN A blend of indigenous Vigiriega (80%), Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. Vineyards are in poor soils of slates at around 1300 metres high, grown respecting the environment without herbicides nor pesticides. Artisanal produce using the wine of the vintage and the juice of the same year but harvested 3 months later avoiding the use of sugar on the tirage. The degorge is made by hand and there’s no dosage in this Natural Sparkling. Aged 24 months. Golden yellow. Very thin bubbles. White fruit, ripe apple, bakery, sesame. CO2 well integrated, oily, great acidity. info@barrancooscuro.com +34 958343066

name: Xarab de M. Valenzuela
description: Barranco Oscuro VSPA PVN 100% Natural Sweet Wine. No sugar added, no alcohol added and almost without sulfites. Made with Pedro Ximenez grapes of the highest vineyards in Europe up to 1350 meters high. Matured 20 months in steel tank and american oak cask. The wine dreamed by Omar Khayyam. Old gold with coppery sparkles. Very complex aromas of figues, orange skin marmalade, animal skin. Oily, extremely (not sickly) sweet but well balanced with its great acidity. Only 580 bottles produced. info@barrancooscuro.com +34 958343066

name: 1368 Pago Cerro Las Monjas 2003
description: Barranco Oscuro VSPA PVN A blend of Garnacha, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot from the organically grown highest vineyards in Europe. Natural produce. Aged in french oak barriques during 17 months. Ruby red colour. In the nose dark berry fruits, spices. Complexity, full-bodied, plenty of tannin, great acidity. info@barrancooscuro.com +34 958343066
